description:
Seen here: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/500770/

http://logs.openstack.org/70/500770/7/check/gate-tempest-dsvm-neutron-full-ubuntu-xenial/b813494/logs/screen-c-api.txt.gz?level=TRACE#_Sep_06_17_25_08_182255

This change in castellan 0.13.0 breaks cinder's ConfKeyManager:

https://github.com/openstack/castellan/commit/1a13c2b2030390e3c0a5d498da486d92ddd1152c

Because the Cinder ConfKeyManager extends the abstract KeyManager class in castellan but doesn't implement the list() method.
title: Castellan 0.13.0 doesn't work with ConfKeyManager due to missing list() abstract method

comments.content:
Seen here: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/500770/

http://logs.openstack.org/70/500770/7/check/gate-tempest-dsvm-neutron-full-ubuntu-xenial/b813494/logs/screen-c-api.txt.gz?level=TRACE#_Sep_06_17_25_08_182255

This change in castellan 0.13.0 breaks cinder's ConfKeyManager:

https://github.com/openstack/castellan/commit/1a13c2b2030390e3c0a5d498da486d92ddd1152c

Because the Cinder ConfKeyManager extends the abstract KeyManager class in castellan but doesn't implement the list() method.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~mriedem

comments.content: This change is in castellan 0.13.0, and at least as of right now, upper-constraints caps castellan to 0.12.0.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~sean-mcginnis

comments.content: This bug should affect nova similarly.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~liujiong

comments.content:
Fix proposed to branch: master
Review: https://review.openstack.org/501533
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~hudson-openstack

comments.content:
Reviewed:  https://review.openstack.org/501398
Committed: https://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/cinder/commit/?id=fa6951c55b5462d6ddca04361363db0c57ce66e2
Submitter: Jenkins
Branch:    master

commit fa6951c55b5462d6ddca04361363db0c57ce66e2
Author: Sean McGinnis <email address hidden>
Date:   Wed Sep 6 14:42:04 2017 -0500

    Implement keymgr list() method
    
    Castellan KeyManager has added an abstract list() method starting
    in release 0.13.0. We are currently safe since upper constraints
    cap it at 0.12.0, but we will want to raise those constraints
    soon.
    
    This method isn't actually used in the Cinder code, but since it's
    an ABC abstract method we must implement it in our ConfKeyMgr. This
    just adds a basic skeleton so we don't blow up on missing the method.
    
    Change-Id: Ie2b2aef40b4de36d011c7efa0ab5af5c9581a63d
    Closes-bug: #1715451
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~hudson-openstack

comments.content:
Reviewed:  https://review.openstack.org/502580
Committed: https://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/castellan/commit/?id=ffd9f484df8d4c6c7de36313beb3a76f0daa8296
Submitter: Jenkins
Branch:    master

commit ffd9f484df8d4c6c7de36313beb3a76f0daa8296
Author: Kaitlin Farr <email address hidden>
Date:   Mon Sep 11 16:54:28 2017 -0400

    Makes list method not abstract
    
    Any implementations of key_manager that don't have "list"
    defined (i.e. ConfKeyManager in Nova and Cinder) will not be
    instantiable if they try to use a version of Castellan
    that was released after "list" was added. Adds a default
    implementation of "list" that returns nothing for backwards
    compatibility.
    
    Closes-Bug: #1715451
    Change-Id: I1e413831163bffaed3a2580f039e242da7d303f8
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~hudson-openstack

comments.content: This issue was fixed in the openstack/castellan 0.14.0 release.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~hudson-openstack

comments.content:
Change abandoned by Jeremy Liu (<email address hidden>) on branch: master
Review: https://review.openstack.org/501533
Reason: This issue has been fixed in castellan 0.14.0 and global requirements already raised castellan minimum to 0.14.0. Abandon as it's not needed now.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~hudson-openstack
